page.title: 08FARMING
page.content: {Arable farming}is mainly north east of the village of Sibson and the two main crops are barley and wheat.They are harvested by combine harvester which unloads the crop direct onto trailers it is then transported to the farm. Crops average about 3.5tonnes to the acre.Straw is either baled by large round balers or square baled.If the straw is not required to help the mixed dairy sector then it is burnt to enable maximum use of the potash for the following years crop. A small partly mechanised farm at Sibson uses a binder for harvesting about 6 acres the crop is then stooked and thrashed. Three cows are hand milked for the house and the rearing of calves.
